thread.title: UPDATE 1-Puerto Rico's PFC did not transfer funds for bond payment -filing
thread.title_full: UPDATE 1-Puerto Rico's PFC did not transfer funds for bond payment -filing | Reuters

author: Reuters
title: UPDATE 1-Puerto Rico's PFC did not transfer funds for bond payment -filing
text:
(Adds budget details)
By Megan Davies
NEW YORK, July 15 (Reuters) - Puerto Rico's Public Finance Corporation (PFC) failed to transfer funds to pay the principal and interest on its bonds, according to a filing on Wednesday, highlighting the cash problems the island is experiencing as it tries to restructure its debt.
The transfer of $93.7 million was for a debt service payment due Aug. 1 by PFC, part of the island's Government Development Bank.
Puerto Rico's Governor Alejandro Garcia Padilla dropped a bombshell on creditors in June by saying the island needed to restructure debts to solve its fiscal problems, while an adviser to the island said the U.S. territory would soon run out of cash.
A source familiar with the situation said no default would be triggered by not moving the funds, as the bonds only require that funds are transferred and paid if they are appropriated.
The PFC, which provides financing to the island's agencies, said it had requested the funds be appropriated in the 2016 budget but they were not included in the budget approved June 30. (Reporting by Megan Davies; additional reporting by Jessica DiNapoli; Editing by Lisa Shumaker )
